text:
Hi folks,
I would like to update one of date property in contact objects. GET call shows the date in timestamp (long format like "value": "1616544000000"). The date I would like to post is in this format “2020-06-09T15:12:37.105Z”. when I run the Post API call I get this error:

"isValid": *false*,
            "message": "2020-06-09T15:12:37.105Z was not a valid long.",
            "error": "INVALID_LONG",
            "name": "ae_completed_date"

I use HubSpot API version V1.
Any thought?
what language? for JS, just do `new Date('2020-06-09T15:12:37.105Z').getTime()`
no way to get all meetings within a date range?

Hello everybody,
I am pretty new to developing, not 100% sure in which Channel to post this either.
Can anybody tell me, what i need to do, when i want to use the php client library(<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php>) inside of a WordPress Plugin?
I added the files to the plugin folder using <https://packagist.org/packages/HubSpot/api-client|composer require HubSpot/api-client>.
But what am i supposed to require in the main file of the plugin in order to use the library in my functions?
I feel like i need to require some file before i can instantiate the API Client etc.

I'm asking a complete BEGINNERS question: I am following along with "Introduction to the HubSpot APIs", I've also read over HubSpot's API docs, I have a developer acct and a test app. Can someone please explain to me how to pull in an API from the HubSpot test app account over to a local environment? This is not explained anywhere that I have watched or read (or maybe I missed that somewhere). Again, I'm very new and trying to learn. I hope my question makes sense and thank you.
I am using Java not JS?
oauth
for apps

I have a key, that's not the problem. Is there a step-by-step on HOW to fetch or pull an app into a local environment? Or can someone explain this? No where in the docs or training videos is this explained. The training literally shows you how to set up a test account and test app, then goes straight into working in a local environment without showing the steps of how to pull in the app.

is it possible to grab the 'PARTNER COMPANIES' property/value which is a salesforce property that is linked to a Deal in HubSpot and showing on the deal itself, to add it to another HubSpot Deal property on the same deal?  I was able to do so with line items using the APIs.

So far, I see that I am able to get the value of the HubSpot property but when I console log the property that is on the Deal that is coming from Salesforce, it is "Null".

Not sure if anyone here has experienced this yet but was hoping to give it a try and ask.  Thank you.
Im having a similiar issue with the Deals to Line Item API. I'm continuing to pass through a null value for the Deal Id

are you trying to associate line items to a renewal deal?  I am using the HubSpotClient API's in Node.js to run all the API's.  You can use the associations API and Update APIs as async/await calls to do that.

thats where I'm having issues. The Assocation is failing because its not passing through the dealid. Before this, the Deal successfully imports in HubSpot (and can see the dealid in HubSpot) but it does not come through to the CRM association.

I've been reading a lot of other users having the same issue in the community boards. I'm submitting my findings to HubSpot Dev because this should be simplistic but cannot figure out why it still passes the dealid as null. Thanks for your feedback!

you will need to first associate them and bring them over with a search object and put the originatinig deal id in that search object properties.  Then you will need to clone, and associate those line items to the new renewal deal.  I learned after a long struggle that the line items have to be cloned, you cant just bring them over with the original deal id properties.

I am wondering if i will need to do the same thing for the 'Partner Companies'.  It looks like HubSpot does not actually see the values in the original deal.  Its been a struggle trying to figure this one out.  Like you said, it should be simplistic but it is not turning out that way.
I am playing around with the products API. this v3 call should create a product with the provided details but is creating an empty one instead. can you see why?

Interesting. Thanks for that. It appeared that I needed to clone and reestablish that record with the association, but just wasnt getting the results anticipated. I believe Partner Companies is my next challenge ironically. I hope to come back and be able to shed some light. I owe you one

That would be very much appreciated! Thanks. I will be working on it, as well and will let you kmow if i figure it out. 

Very happy to have been able to help out there on the line items.
I'm still struggling but you gave a couple ideas to move forward with. Thanks again, Jay!

I have done a bunch of different steps to try to get the partner company value including using the read api on companies, deals properties. keep getting null or undefined
starting to think that this property cant be read, perhaps because it is a salesforce value that is pulled into HubSpot

I have done a bunch of different steps to try to get the partner company value including using the read api on companies, deals properties. keep getting null or undefined
starting to think that this property cant be read, perhaps because it is a salesforce value that is pulled into HubSpot

<@UT35DSBMF> what do you mean by "empty" – are all the fields blank – I would think at least one (maybe Name) would be required, but not seeing this called out in the docs.

What is the response/response body to the API call?

*Question: Can I Sync Contact & Product (Using HubSpot API) with the Free plan?*

Hi,
For a mobile app/platform, on AWS we are hosting a relational database, Postgres (AWS Aurora), that contains basic user Contact info (name, email, etc). We’d like to two-way sync that info to HubSpot CRM, in order to use SalesHub and MarketingHub. 

The question is:

1) What plan we need in order to sync (two-way) “Contact info” between HubSpot and AWS (or any other 3rd party platform) basic ?

2) Reading HubSpot documentation says “The API allows for two means of authentication, OAth and via API. Using Oath 2.0, per link [1] below, seem to require Professional plan? Using API, link [2] below, says “Applies to all plans, that means we can do two-way sync with the Free plan?

3) Also interested in syncing Products (described in link [3] below). What HubSpot plan is required? 

3b) Is is possible for products to create a custom field for Picture? If so, would HubSpot has a way to send to AWS S3?

Thanks in advance for any help. If something needs further clarification please just let me know.

[1] <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/initiate-oauth-integration#scopes,%C2%A0>
[2] <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/Integrations/How-do-I-get-my-HubSpot-API-key?_ga=2.250797440.787510528.1618505379-307363244.1618505379>
[3] <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/deals/how-do-i-use-products>
